children.subject: i originally entered before fall 2015, so math 1a/b, 54 & cs 61 series and cs 70 would all count towards my gpa requirement

For Math 54, I highly recommend the SLC Adjunct [1]. It helped me do really well in the class and not be lost during the crazy last third with diff eqs, fourier series, and the heat eqn.

[1] http://slc.berkeley.edu/math-54

history.content:
i am an intended cs minor considering the major instead. i’ve done well in the 61 series and need to finish math 54 and cs 70.

would the workload of cs 186, cs 161, and math 54 be manageable? i didn’t do so well in math 1b (i got a D), so i’m not completely confident in my math skills. i’m also considering retaking math 1b and still keeping 186/161 .i’m prioritizing the upper divs because if i can’t declare the major i don’t want to face the risk of not completing the minor bc i can’t enroll in upper divs in the future.
history.subject: cs 186, cs 161, and math 54 courseload
